00022 /**
00023  * @file   simpleRmaExample.cpp
00024  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00025  * @date   Thu Jan 12 11:06:30 2006
00026  * 
00027  * @brief A simple example of RMA as implemented in the ChipStream
00028  * framework to give a flavor of how things work. To keep example
00029  * simple and readable very little error checking is done as we
00030  * progress. Please do not use this example for real life data
00031  * analysis.
00032  */
00033 
00034 #include "chipstream/AnalysisStreamFactory.h"
00035 #include "chipstream/CelReader.h"
00036 #include "chipstream/DiskIntensityMart.h"
00037 //
00038 #include <cstring>
00039 #include <iostream>
00040 #include <string>
00041 #include <vector>
00042 //
00043 
00044 /** 
00045  * Perform Robust Multichip Average (RMA) analysis on the cel files
00046  * specified. This simple example doesn't do very much in the way of
00047  * error checking and shouldn't be included as error checking.
00048  * 
00049  * @param cdfFile - Layout of probesets on chip.
00050  * @param outDir - Directory to write results to.
00051  * @param numCelFiles - How many cel files are in the array.
00052  * @param celFiles - Array of cel file names to be used.
00053  */
00054 void doRma(const string cdfFile, const string outDir, vector<string> &celFiles) {
00055   ChipLayout layout;               // Specifies probesets, locations of features on chip.
00056   AnalysisStream *aStream = NULL;  // Composite of chipstream, pmadjuster and quantification method to do anlysis.
00057   AnalysisStreamFactory asFactory; // Factory used to construct an analysis stream according to string representation.
00058   CelReader cReader;               // Object for getting data from cel files.
00059 
00060   /* Get the layout for the chip. */
00061   Verbose::out(1,"Opening cdf file: " + ToStr(cdfFile));
00062   layout.openCdfAll(cdfFile);
00063 
00064   vector<int> desiredOrder;
00065   for(unsigned int psIx = 0; psIx < layout.getProbeSetCount(); psIx++) {
00066       ProbeListPacked pl = layout.getProbeListAtIndex(psIx);
00067       for(int pIx = 0; pIx < pl.probe_cnt(); pIx++) {
00068           desiredOrder.push_back(pl.get_probeId(pIx));
00069       }
00070   }
00071   DiskIntensityMart iMart(
00072                 desiredOrder,
00073                 celFiles,
00074                 50 * 1048576, 
00075                 outDir,
00076                 "multiChannelExample.tmp", 
00077                 true);
00078 
00079   /* Construct the analysis we are going to do. In this case an
00080      rma background subtraction followed by a quantile normalization
00081      using only perfect match probes and summarize probe sets with a 
00082      median polish. Also known as RMA. Commas separate modules, periods
00083      deliminate object specific parameters. */
00084   aStream = asFactory.constructAnalysisStream("rma-bg,quant-norm.sketch=0.usepm=true.bioc=true,pm-only,med-polish",
00085                                               layout);
00086   /* Uncomment next line to have "simplerPlierExample instead. */
00087   //   aStream = asFactory.constructAnalysisStream("quant-norm.pm-mm,plier", layout);
00088 
00089   //@todo need to fix due to refactor for A5
00090   //aStream->addTextReporter(outDir, 5, true, false, false); 
00091   /* As cel files are read the chipstream wants to see them and learn parameters. */
00092   cReader.registerStream(aStream->getChipStreamHead());
00093   /* As cel files are read the data cache needs to store intensities. */
00094   cReader.registerIntensityMart(&iMart);
00095 
00096   /* Specify the cel files to open. */
00097   cReader.setFiles(celFiles);
00098   Verbose::out(1,"Reading cel files.");
00099   /* Open, read, and send cel file data one by one to chipstream and imart. */
00100   cReader.readFiles();
00101 
00102   /* Loop through all of our probe sets and do RMA for each one. */
00103   Verbose::out(1,"Doing analysis.");
00104   AnalysisInfo info = aStream->getInfo();
00105   // @todo: fixme -jhg
00106   aStream->addStdHeaders("",
00107                          "",
00108                          "simpleRmaExample", 
00109                          // iMart.getRowNames(),
00110                          "simpleRmaExample", 
00111                          info);
00112   for(unsigned int psIx = 0; psIx < layout.getProbeSetCount(); psIx++) {
00113     ProbeListPacked pList = layout.getProbeListAtIndex(psIx);
00114     ProbeSet *ps = ProbeListFactory::asProbeSet(pList);
00115     ProbeSetGroup group(ps);     // psGroup should delete the memory for ps...
00116     aStream->doAnalysis(group, iMart, true);
00117   }
00118   delete aStream;
00119 }
00120 
00121 /** Everybody's favorite function. */
00122 int main(int argc, const char *argv[]) {
00123   if(argc < 4) {
00124     cerr << 
00125       "simpleRmaExample - Program to demonstrate AnalysisStream\n"
00126       "framework. Does RMA on a series of cel files. Does very little error\n"
00127       "checking to keep example code easy to read. Please do not use this\n"
00128       "program for real life analysis.\n"
00129       "\n"
00130       "usage:\n"
00131       "   simpleRmaExample cdfFile.cdf outputDir celFile1 celFile2 ... celFileN\n" 
00132          << endl;
00133     exit(1);
00134   }
00135   string cdfFile = argv[1];
00136   string outDir = argv[2];
00137   vector<string> celFiles;
00138   for(int i=3; i < argc; i++)
00139       celFiles.push_back(argv[i]);
00140   doRma(cdfFile, outDir, celFiles);
00141 }
